Title: Developing 3D action puzzle game application "the Mechanic" using UNITY
Source title: 2015 IEEE Conference on e-Learning, e-Management and e-Services, IC3e 2015
Affiliations: Language Center, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Oktriono, K., Language Center, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Chong, H., School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Piterson, School of Computer Science, BINUS University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The aim of the research is to develop a PC platform 3d action puzzle game application with a game play that stimulates players think logically. "The Mechanic" game application allows player to be entertained with the challenging obstacles in the game play and heroic story that inculcate the user the virtue of perennial nobility and aligned with a specific educational setting. Data collection methods are questionnaire, literature study, and observation of similar game application. The Application Design method applied is agile scrum. This method allows us to build a game application more efficiently and flexibly since it allows us to improve our game design on every iteration of the scrum process. The conclusion of this research is 3D action puzzle game "The Mechanic" entertain the player with the challenging game play and heroic story. © 2015 IEEE.
Index Keywords: E-learning; Mechanics; Personal computers; 3D games; action; Application design; Data collection method; Educational settings; Literature studies; puzzle; Puzzle games; Iterative methods
